posts.name: Jin Lin
posts.cooked:
We bought a roboRio from a retired FRC team, and try to reformat it, But always failed.

This is the error message we got image 784×471 22.1 KB

image 784×471 22.1 KB

image 784×471 22.1 KB

Does anyone have any idea how to solve this issue? Thanks!

posts.name: ahartnet
posts.cooked:
I’m going to start with the obvious questions:

did you try an the suggestions listed (run as administrator, put the Rio into safe mode, etc)

have you tried multiple computers?

posts.name: Jin Lin
posts.cooked: Yes, We tried all the suggestions, We still can’t reformat it.

posts.name: ahartnet
posts.cooked:
Then unfortunately you will want to post in the NI forums. I had to do similarly ( Roborio unable to image, continuous flashing status LED - NI Community )

I received a PM with a link and instructions to a recovery process that I tried about 10 times with 3 USBs before I got it to work.

You may be able to reach out to some directly rather than the forum, I’m unsure.

posts.name: Chadfrom7226
posts.cooked: I know this is a useless comment, but something similar happened to us 2 years ago. I finally brought it home to mess with and it just all of a sudden started working again…

posts.name: Jin Lin
posts.cooked: Thanks for all the help. I posted it to NI forums. will update after the issue is fixed.

posts.name: Garrett Dicken
posts.cooked:
There are a few things to try. I recommend using a USB as it is more reliable than flashing via Ethernet.

Try placing the Rio into safe mode. Hold the reset button down until the status light is solid, then release it. It should do 3 quick blinks, pause, then repeat. Try flashing now.

If safe mode fails it may be because the firmware is too old and the rio flashing tool cannot talk to it. I forget the cutoff, but I know somewhere prior to FW 3.X.X the tool fails. To update it, use the roborio imaging tool. If that fails you need to open up NIMAX and update the firmware to the current. I forget the current one, but it is version 6.x.x and it has an F somewhere in the name.

Configuring the roboRIO: The roboRIO Imaging Tool will be used to image your roboRIO with the latest software. USB Connection: Highlights the USB Type B input at the top of the roboRIO. Connect a U...

link_counts.title: Imaging your roboRIO — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Jin Lin
posts.cooked: Thanks for the reply. Where can I find the FW 3. X.X or 4.x.X. There is only 6.0.0 in the roboRIO Imaging tool?

posts.name: Garrett Dicken
posts.cooked:
You want to use 6.0.0.cfg. Previous versions are from prior years and I do not recommend using them.

What FW is currently on the Rio? It would show up in the bottom left of that screen when a Rio is connected.

posts.name: Jin Lin
posts.cooked: I updated the Firmware to 6.0 already. In the NI forum, They suggested to “update” to FW 5.0, But I have no idea where is the FW 5.0.0

posts.name: Garrett Dicken
posts.cooked:
What is your computer’s name? If there are any non-alpha numeric characters it could cause it to fail.

Have you tried disabling your firewall before trying to image?

posts.name: Jin Lin
posts.cooked:
The firewall is disabled, we tried different computers also. The computer’s name is “DESKTOP-G0PTSLM”, it should be good.

There is no issue updating the firmware. But it can’t format the target.

posts.name: Garrett Dicken
posts.cooked: Try removing the hypen. I haven’t had issues, but I know some teams did.

posts.name: Jin Lin
posts.cooked: Thanks for the reply. I changed the computer name to “NTCFR01” and test again. The error is there still.

posts.name: tkchan
posts.cooked:
okay, let me get a clear picture.  So based on that image you posted, you are able to put version 6.0 of the firmware on the RoboRIO and you were also able to configure it to your team number (7520).

So now the issue that you have now is flashing the RoboRIO.  What are you trying to flash it to?  (specifically what year)?  Show us the directory folder and highlight what you are trying to use.  Hopefully this is not some custom made image you are trying to do.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: think outside of the box from time to time

posts.custom_user_title: think outside of the box from time to time

posts.name: Jin Lin
posts.cooked:
Here is what we are doing: 1)We can update the Firmware 5.0.0 or 6.0.0

we try to flash the RoboRIO, We tried 2018,2019,2020 and 2021, all of them are failed.

We also try to copy these files (from 2018 to 2021) into roboRIO using WinSCP and USB flash. They have failed also.

image 1659×744 39.7 KB

image 1659×744 39.7 KB

image 1659×744 39.7 KB

posts.name: tkchan
posts.cooked:
my recollection is that firmware is paired to image version.  I believed Firmware 6.0.0f1 should correspond to either 2019 or 2020 (I will go check this weekend on what we have to be sure).

So a couple more thing:

how are you powering your RoboRIO.

make sure that you disconnect ALL but the power to the RoboRIO.  Make sure in you do a full power cycle of the RoboRIO after a firmware update.  And that make sure all lights are ‘good’.

disconnected everything off the computer and only use the USB cable to connect between the company and the roborio (judging by your IP, it looks like you are already).  [This include disconnecting it to any printer - wired/wifi/usb/anyway, same for any WIFI/Ethernet, etc].

Reason for # 3 is to avoid any ‘surprised’ IP on any other device(s) that might be in a mis-configured mode.
